docs.title: Make sure to read the policies
Device Manipulation
docs.text:
Device manipulation is where the game will interact with your computer in ways that other programs usually will not, below is all the features and limits we have setup for each feature.

📝 Note: This can all be disabled and usually is disabled by default in the options.

docs.title: Window Movement [PC ONLY]
docs.text:
Window movement is where your actual game window moves around your desktop, this is usually used to distract you and add an extra layer of difficulty to the gameplay.

Our game has 2 options for it:

  • Simulated (Simulated creates a fake desktop in the game and moves around a pretend window. This doesn't touch your actual computer.)
  • Real (Real tracks the position of the window and moves it around the available space on your display. This does not do anything malicious and does not touch any functions that godot does not provide us.)

docs.title: You can find examples below from different rhythm games
Rhythm Doctor
docs.text: I dont know any others lmao  ## Wallpaper Changing [PC ONLY]  Wallpaper changing is as the name says, it simply changes your wallpaper. If you exit the game or the game needs to reset it your wallpaper will return to normal.  > 📝 **Note:** If you have something such as lively wallpaper or wallpaper engine installed and running, it may show up above the default OS wallpaper or as a replacement of it. Meaning that we cannot change it, if a wallpaper program is running you wont see it change and we will not close the program for you.  ## spooky mouse movement [PC ONLY]  It just moves your mouse, this makes using your mouse impossible while it happens, either pause the game or close the game using a keyboard bind [Alt+F4 for Windows, CMD+Q for Mac OS]

docs.title: Collab Policy
docs.text: Collabs are a tricky thing, they require planning and development time to produce, thus in order to not fill up on unnecessary or controversial collabs these policies dictate who exactly can be collabed with.

docs.title: Collabs with the following will be declined
docs.text:
• Games that are created without the use of artificial intelligence
  • games that are blacklisted (ones ive had bad experiences with or just dont like) will not be collabed with, I do not have to tell you why.
  • Roblox games
  • NSFW games
  • Games created by people with bad controversy

docs.title: Extra Information
docs.text:
• Communities do not dictate a game, whether a community is bad or not should not matter for a collab
  • I may pick and choose to say yes or no to collabs at any time, it could be from something as simple as just not wanting to collab to something as complex as personal grudges. Explanations do not always need to be provided.
  • Collabs are a team effort, if a collab is to happen then both parties work together, not independently.

docs.title: Community Content Policy
docs.text:
• Flag sexual content (lyrical and visual) with the correct tag.
  • straight NSFW is strictly prohibited. If found, said content will be removed and you will be blacklisted from uploading anything new to the workshop
  • blood and slight gore is allowed (fake open wounds, bruises, blood) only if tagged correctly
  • extreme gore is not allowed (dismemberment, organs, raw flesh, real life gore [keep your gore light and fake]), if gore is fake but extreme its allowed only if sillhoutted
  • Extreme fetish content is a NO (sexualised gore, scat, urination, anything on this wavelength)
  • No malicious software is to be packaged into the content, nor is any content allowed to abuse bugs to cause harm to the users system. if you wanna do something cool that you currently cant, dont exploit a flaw to do it, ask me for it instead, or check with other community members if a way to do so is already provided.
  • Swearing is allowed, slurs are not allowed (if a song contains slurs its best to censor them)
  • All community levels are unrated, by playing them players agree that whatever they may encounter is not the responsibility of the developers, any abusive content that violates these policies can be reported.
  • Links are allowed as long as they do not link to malicious software, scams, or adult sites.
  • Keep it safe, do not use community content to doxx, harrass, insult, or spread hatred.
  • Avoid bringing politics into your content
  • Follow the steam, itch, google play store, and apple app store TOS when creating community content.

docs.title: By accessing the editor you agree to follow the above and not violate any of the things listed, if done so we reserve the right to blacklist you from the steam workshop and any community servers
docs.text: 📝 Note: Although you can be blacklisted from the steam workshop and community servers, this does NOT remove your right to access features in the game. You may continue to enjoy the game, continue to create community content, and play other people's community content. A blacklist simply means the official ways of sharing community content and interacting with the community were removed.

docs.title: Monetization Policy
docs.text:
• You are allowed to monetize videos of gameplay or custom songs created for and in the game.

  • Handling copyrighted content is your own responsibility.

  • You cannot sell community content. Keep it free yeah?

  • You cannot use the songs in this game, this game itself, any of its assets or code, both ripped and leaked to make a commercial product.

  • You cannot resell or redistribute the game on other platforms, we will redistribute.

  • This game is and will always be free, anything offering this game for money is a scam and should be avoided.

docs.title: Violating any of the above will result in a blacklist from the steam workshop and any community servers

docs.title: Song Request Policy
docs.text:
If a song is requested from an artist that does not directly work for the game the following applies:

  1. The artist may set limits on what content of theirs can and cannot be used, the game itself and community must abide by those set restrictions.
  2. The artist is allowed to pull their permissions for song use at any time, if so people are not to harass said artist, any custom community content will be removed from the steam workshop.
  3. Artists may reach out and change permissions for the game, removing and giving permissions as they feel fit.
  4. Artists may feel free to ask any questions about the game at any time to get a better understanding of what type of game their song is going to be used in.
  5. If an artist declines permission that is to be respected and artist is to be added to a blacklist, songs of theirs cannot be used unless they reach out to the developers and give permission, begging the artist will get you nowhere and can possibly lead to a workshop upload ban.
  6. If an artist cannot give out permissions for specific songs due to copyright, those songs cannot be used (Exclusive songs fall under this umbrella)
  7. Remixes and covers require permission from the original songs creator, not just the person who made the remix.
  8. If permission is requested from a player and not a developer then do not take anything they say or do as something endorsed by the developers directly. We only ask for permission ourselves if asking for a collab or requesting permissions for music.

📝 Note: You can find a list of which artists are allowed and which artists are not at this link [PLACEHOLDER WEBSITE]
